settings.heading: Racquet Sports 101: Your Ultimate Guide to Getting in the Game

settings.text: Racquet sports are having a moment—and for good reason. Whether you’re chasing pickleball trends, hitting the tennis courts, or trying your hand at badminton, these games are the perfect mix of cardio, strategy, and good vibes. Not to mention, they’re social, accessible, and a killer way to stay active. Ready to dive in? Here’s everything you need to know to pick your game (and your fit) with confidence.

settings.title: Step 1: Start with Hero Pieces
settings.text:
Choose versatile, high-quality staples in multiple colors:

  • Washed Pocket Tee: Optic White, Cream, Khaki, Faded Navy, Faded Black.
  • Standard Classic Polo: Dark Navy, Burgundy, Dark Green, True Black, White, Academy Green.
  • Pique Short: Darkest Navy, Silver Melange, White.
  • Pique Pintuck Joggers: True Black, Dark Navy, Academy Green, White, Silver Melange, Atlantic Navy, Charcoal Gray.
  • Classic Short with Cargo Pocket: Dark Navy, Academy Green, Grindle, Darkest Charcoal Marl.

• Neutrals First: Build a base with shades like White, Cream, and Faded Black.
  • Add Depth: Incorporate richer tones like Academy Green and Burgundy to switch things up.

Example: Pair the Washed Pocket Tee in Khaki with Pique Pintuck Joggers in Silver Melange for a relaxed yet polished look.

settings.title: Step 3: Style Like a Pro
settings.text:
• Monochrome Looks: Keep it clean with tonal outfits, like the Pique Short in Darkest Navy and Standard Classic Polo in Dark Navy.
  • Play with Texture: Pair smooth fabrics (like the Washed Pocket Tee) with textured ones (like the Pique Pintuck Joggers).
  • Try the Sandwich Method: Match your top and shoes, using a contrasting bottom.

Example: Washed Pocket Tee in Cream + Pique Joggers in Dark Navy + white sneakers.

settings.title: Step 4: Keep It Fresh
settings.text: Rotating different colors of the same item creates variety while maintaining consistency. For example, swap between the Standard Classic Polo in Burgundy and Dark Green with Darkest Charcoal Marl Cargo Shorts throughout the week.

settings.section_heading_1: 1. Why Racquet Sports Are the Perfect New Year’s Move
settings.content_1:
Okay, here’s the deal: racquet sports aren’t just for pros or country clubs. They’re versatile, fun, and ridiculously good for you. Plus:
Great Cardio: You’ll be sprinting, swinging, and burning calories without even realizing it.
Social Fun: Perfect for catching up with friends, showing off a cute fit, or even flexing your competitive streak.
Low Barrier to Entry: You don’t need much to start—just a racquet, a ball (or shuttlecock), and some motivation.
It’s Always Game Time: Indoors or outdoors, there’s a court (or table) waiting for you.
Starting the year with racquet sports means you’re already serving up those 2025 goals.
settings.content_2:
Not sure which game is for you? Here’s a quick intro to the most popular racquet sports:
- Tennis: A mix of power and precision. Perfect for full-body movement and those who love the classics. It’s great for endurance and building skill while enjoying an open court.
- Pickleball: A social favorite and easy to pick up, making it the ideal sport for beginners. Played on a smaller court, it’s accessible, fun, and perfect for casual matches with friends.
- Padel: Think tennis, but with walls. Fast-paced and incredibly dynamic, it’s rising as a global favorite for its emphasis on teamwork and longer rallies.
- Squash: High-intensity cardio in a compact court. Think fast reflexes and endless sweat—it’s a workout and a strategy game all in one.
- Racquetball: Similar to squash but with a larger racquet and ball. Perfect for fast, powerful rallies with fewer rules and a bit more room to move.
- Badminton: All about agility and finesse. Played with a shuttlecock, it’s a go-to for casual fun or highly competitive matches.
- Table Tennis: Small table, big energy. This game is perfect for sharpening reflexes and testing hand-eye coordination—no large court required.
settings.section_heading_3: 3. Look Good, Play Better: What to Wear
settings.content_3:
The right gear keeps you comfortable, mobile, and game-ready. From clothes to accessories, these picks are perfect for any racquet sport:
- Hii Energy Bra: High-impact support with a sleek design, ideal for squash or racquetball.
- Daisy Shorts (Long and Short): Lightweight and stretchy for warm-ups or match point.
- Angelique Bra: Stylish with reliable support, great for casual or light games.
- Giselle Bra: Open-back design for breathability and flexibility, perfect for tennis.
- Pleated Tennis Skirt: A court classic, offering freedom of movement for tennis or pickleball.
- Pique Short: Refined fit and breathable fabric for cool comfort in any game.
- Pique Short Sleeve: Polished and versatile, perfect for table tennis or padel.
- Trainer Tee: Lightweight and easy to layer, made for high-energy sessions.
- Classic Shorts: Functional pockets and relaxed fit for racquetball or post-game cool-downs.

settings.text:
• Court-Ready Sneakers: Lightweight, non-slip shoes designed for stability and speed on any court surface.
  • Moisture-Wicking Socks: Keep your feet dry and blister-free during intense games.
  • Performance Cap: Protects you from the sun while adding a sporty edge to your outfit.
  • Wristbands and Headbands: Keep sweat out of your eyes and hands for better focus during matches.
  • Classic Tote Bag: Spacious enough to carry your gear, racquet, and essentials, on and off the court.
  • Grip Tape: Refresh your racquet’s grip for better control and comfort during play.

settings.section_heading_1: 5. Effortless Layering: Raglan Cross-Fit Tee + Quarter Zipper Sweater
settings.content_1:
Layering isn’t just about staying warm—it’s about showing depth. Start with the Raglan Cross-Fit Tee, then add the Quarter Zipper Sweater on top. Ideal for chillier days.
Style Hack: Pair with dark denim and Chelsea boots for a polished look. Or cuff your jeans and go for sneakers if you’re keeping it casual.
settings.section_heading_2: 6. Rugged Meets Refined: Smart Pique Jacket + Heritage Cargo Jogger
settings.content_2:
For days when you’re venturing outdoors but still want to look put-together, throw on the Smart Pique Jacket with the Heritage Cargo Jogger. It’s the perfect blend of utility and style—like you could build a fire or close a business deal, no big deal.
Pro Tip: Finish the look with sturdy boots and a beanie.
settings.section_heading_3: 7. Monochrome Magic: French Terry Tee + Pique Pintuck Jogger
settings.content_3:
One color, head to toe, makes you look like you’ve got your life together—even if you overslept. The French Terry Tee and Pique Pintuck Jogger  create a sleek, streamlined silhouette that’s simple, modern, and just the right amount of bold.
Style Advice: Add neutral sneakers to keep the vibe minimalist, or throw in a statement piece like a chunky chain or backpack.

settings.text:
No matter which racquet sport you’re drawn to, these tips will help you jump in:

  1. Choose the Right Racquet: Each sport has its own gear—make sure you have the right racquet for optimal performance.
  2. Learn the Basics: Spend time understanding the rules and key techniques before diving into a game.
  3. Start Small: Find beginner-friendly games or classes to build your confidence.
  4. Focus on Footwork: Movement is key in racquet sports, so practice agility and quick direction changes.
  5. Have Fun: It’s not about winning—it’s about staying active, having fun, and enjoying the moment.

settings.heading: 5. Your Next Steps: Game, Set, PLAY!

settings.text: Wear your best training clothes, find a court, and let the games begin. And don’t forget to tag us in your racquet-sport adventures with #MoveWithGaltsand—we’d love to see you in action!
